title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: R. M. Manly to Roswell Waldo, October 28, 1868
summary: Manly asks Waldo to inform the Methodist Church in Waynesboro that they promised to use their church as a school house for all children, regardless of religious denomination, and Bureau funding was given to them on that condition. Manly writes that the Bureau expects them to uphold their promise and keep the school open for all.
keywords: Education, Aid/Relief, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
